definition[0]: a part of the sea where fish are caught in large numbers
example[0]: the agriculture, forest and fishery sectors of the economy
definition[3]: a part of the sea where fish are caught as a business
example[1]: The Peruvian anchovy fishery is one of the largest in the world.
definition[4]: the fishing industry. Fisheries is often used in the names of organizations involved in industrial fishing
example[2]: The National Fisheries Institute is a trade group that represents seafood producers, processors, distributors and brokers.
